bibl.title: Augustus and the Kingship of Egypt
bibl.note: The anti-Egyptianism credited to Augustus was primarily Dio's, not Augustus'. The proof lies in the Egyptian evidence. Augustus' titularies provide a striking refutation of the conventional view.
bibl.seg: DUNDAS Gregory S., Augustus and the Kingship of Egypt.
The anti-Egyptianism credited to Augustus was primarily Dio's, not Augustus'. The proof lies in the Egyptian evidence. Augustus' titularies provide a striking refutation of the conventional view.
